snippet: Some corporate pork buyers are refusing to buy pork derived from farms that use tiny gestation crates, but farmers argue that the crates are for the good of the sow — and consumers.
abstract: Hog farmers are under increasing pressure form corporate pork buyers and animal rights groups to stop using small gestation crates for pregnant sows; producers insist that using the crates helps keep sows safe, while reducing the overall cost of production.
lead_paragraph: Some corporate pork buyers are refusing to buy pork derived from farms that use tiny gestation crates, but farmers argue that the crates are for the good of the sow — and consumers.

headline.seo: Pig Farmers Face Pressure on the Size of the Sty
headline.main: Pig Farmers Face Pressure on the Size of the Sty
headline.print_headline: A Feud Over the Size of the Sty

keywords.value: Humane Society of the United States
